propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.disabled: If true, the label should be displayed in a disabled state.
propDescriptions.error: If true, the label is displayed in an error state.
propDescriptions.filled: If true, the label should use filled classes key.
propDescriptions.focused: If true, the input of this label is focused (used by FormGroup components).
propDescriptions.required: If true, the label will indicate that the input is required.

focused.description: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `focused={true}`.

disabled.description: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `disabled={true}`.

error.description: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `error={true}`.

filled.description: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `filled={true}`.

required.description: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `required={true}`.
